application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: T5. Oak Tree. 9 metres in height. Single stemmed and vertical with a slightly unbalanced crown. Facilitative pruning to ensure an adequate clearance to prevent accidental breakage. Down lift the lower branches by 1 metres so the branches are at least 3.5 metres where they over hang the proposed new garden room. Tree is very overgrown and the low limbs at taking over quite a lot of the garden. Situated in the rear garden.T9. Honey Locust. 15 metres in height. Twin stemmed at 2 metres with an unbalanced crown. Fell and stump grind. Tree is very overgrown and taking up a lot of the garden. Also blocking a lot of natural sunlight. Situated in the rear garden.T6. Ash Tree. 16 metres in height. Single stemmed and vertical with a slightly unbalanced crown. Fell and stump grind. Advanced Symptoms of Ash dieback, sparse canopy and significant deadwood. Tree is very overgrown and taking up a lot of the garden space. Also blocking a lot of natural sunlight. Situated in the rear garden.T7. Ash Tree. 12 metres in height. Twin stemmed at 0.5 metres with an unbalanced crown. Symptoms of an early infection of Ash dieback and very overgrown, blocking a lot of natural sunlight in the rear garden. Situated in the rear garden.Tree replacements as directed by the Dulwich Estate.
decision_conditions: Standard time limit - Trees Con Area
